intro: Daubenya coccinea, commonly known as the red hot poker, is a perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It features striking, fiery red bracts that surround its yellow flowers, creating a dramatic visual display. The plant has strap-like, dark green leaves that are narrow and upright, contributing to its architectural appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Daubenya coccinea is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
